data.title: Outstanding fresh cooked food well worth the wait!
data.text: We are very impressed! The best soul food I've had that wasn't home cooked. This place should be franchised, there is a constant flow of customers getting to go orders. Limited seating, friendly and great service. Had the fried pork chops, greens and Macaroni & Cheese. Very good!

data.title: Great soul food
data.text: Attentive service, and mouth watering food. This is the second time my girlfriend and I have been there and the food is always delicious . Will be back .

data.title: Dinner
data.text: This place is has horrible service will not eat here again. Everytime l go here it's a problem. My last Vist here weds I  waited 25 mins for them to come out and tell me they out of pork chops. Then I requested my money back didn't want anything else from here they gave me the run around trying to make me pick another item. After 10 more mins I finally was refunded. This is my last time going here. I will take my money somewhere else.. I usually take the ride down to Mama Lucy's on 119th st and 22nd ave its a ride since I stay in Pembroke pines. But the service and food is well worth the ride.

data.title: The Wait
data.text: I frequent this place because the food is good. But you have to wait forever. Even when you call ahead you still have to wait for at least another 30 minutes.

data.title: Best southern fried chicken and candied yams in South Florida
data.text: The fried chicken was fresh, not greasy and it tasted so good, there literally are no words to describe it except to say that it is the best fried chicken I personally ever had anywhere; the candied yams are a work of art and the peach cobbler is homemade; it does not get better than this if you want this very special type of food.  You will not be disappointed.

data.title: OUTSTANDING!
data.text: nice place in the cut! had the ribs, mac and cheese and collard greens! great great woo woo woo!, wifey had the catfish greens and potato salad, she was very happy! we will hit up again after a good cleanse! haha!

data.title: 30 minute drive wasted
data.text: While on vacation in Miami, I drove 30 minutes to this place hoping to get some good soul food. The girl at the cash register wasn't that helpful as were new customers. As soon as I make a decision about what I want, she whispers in her coworkers ear (which is unprofessional and childish). Nevertheless, we got our food and it was ok. I'm not a great cook and I feel like I could have fixed the food I ate. I ordered the catfish, mac and cheese, and collard greens. Won't be back.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Great soul food, which is hard to come by in this area. The service at the counter left a little to be desired, but the food was excellent. Try the southern fried chicken, candied yams, and macaroni & cheese.

data.title: Finally soul food in Pembroke Pines
data.text: This place is excellent has different variety of soul food, from collard greens, fried chicken, sweet potatoes, corn bread, fried fish etc. Place does not have a lot space to sit down but it excellent for take out order. I highly recommend the mac cheese with fried chicken. Average price for two meal $25.00,
